ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: Ministry of Defence, Ships, Maritime Platform Systems (MPS)

ORGANISATION.OFFICIALNAME: Ministry of Defence, Ships, Maritime Platform Systems (MPS)

TITLE_CONTRACT.P: Platform Control and Surveillance Equipment and Systems - Invitation to Participate in Early Market Engagement

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: Defence Equipment and Support (DE&S) is due to renew the support arrangements it has in place for the suite of Platform Control and Surveillance Equipment and Systems.

The Machinery Control and Surveillance (MCAS) systems comprise of centralised control consoles; electrical, environmental, and auxiliary machinery panels within the console and, local control panels. These consoles are used to control and monitor internal ship activities such as power generation and distribution, sea and water systems, main propulsion, platform systems and auxiliary systems.

The systems are made up of a number of panels, sub-assemblies and components that have electrical, mechanical and electronic functions and associated peripherals including sensors. The components within the panels and the sub-assemblies include items such as light indicators, push switches, display units, meters, gaskets, modules, knobs, and printed circuit board (PCB) assemblies. It is an essential requirement that equipment supplied and repaired meets Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) specification where applicable and is physically proven via test criteria and conditions, potentially reliant on bespoke test equipment; this is critical prior to return to ship / MoD.
Further information about DE&S can be found here: https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/defence-equipment-and-support

The proposed procurement and delivery strategy is to structure the requirement, and the future competition into 5 Lots. However, DE&S is seeking to explore whether value for money can be achieved in merging or combining some or all lots. DE&S wishes to undertake early market engagement to seek feedback from the market on its proposed procurement and delivery strategy. The early market engagement will provide suppliers with an insight into the Authority’s proposed procurement strategy, the timescales associated with the procurement and the contract as well as to invite feedback from the market on our current plans. The Authority will use the feedback to further validate our procurement and delivery strategy.

LOT_PRIOR_INFORMATION.LOT_TITLE: Support of Electrical and Control Systems — T23/Single Role Mine Hunter MCAS, Telegraphs (Ships and Subs)

LOT_DESCRIPTION.P: Support for MCAS systems; spares, repairs, post design services (PDS), technical support and production services for continuing design review, update and support for MCAS systems, ancillary and local Controls, Power distribution Systems, Submarine Controls and associated peripherals and parts fitted to Royal Navy (RN) vessels and training establishments. Repair services for equipment listed in tender documents when issued. Supply of Items of equipment listed in the tender documents when issued. Assurance of the continued reference set / test facility availability; much of this equipment is of specific OEM supply and ability to engage with suppliers will be paramount.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: Further information will be provided as part of the tender documents. The scope of the contract will cover approximately 400 NATO Stock Number (NSN) items for spares and repairs.

LOT_PRIOR_INFORMATION.LOT_TITLE: Support of Local Control Panels (LCP), Systems and Spares for Ships and Subs

LOT_DESCRIPTION.P: Support for local control panels, systems and associated peripherals and parts fitted to RN vessels and HMS Sultan (“Teddington electronics” spares or equivalent). PDS, technical support and production services for the continuing design, review, update and support of Local Control Panels and associated peripherals and parts fitted to RN vessels and Training Establishments. Repair services for equipment listed in tender documents when issued. Supply of items of equipment listed in the tender documents. This equipment is of specific OEM supply and their support is critical for maintaining the MoD’s (RN) capability.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: Further information will be provided as part of the tender documents. The scope of the contract will cover approximately 400 NSN items for spares and repairs.

LOT_PRIOR_INFORMATION.LOT_TITLE: Support of T23 Data Capture Analysis Units

LOT_DESCRIPTION.P: Support of data capture analysis Systems and associated parts for T23 class platforms. PDS, technical support and production services for the continuing design, review, update and support of data capture and analysis systems and associated peripherals and parts fitted to RN vessels. Repair services for equipment listed in the tender documents. Supply of items of equipment listed in the tender documents – specific supply from specialist OEM.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: Further information will be provided when the future competition is launched.

LOT_PRIOR_INFORMATION.LOT_TITLE: Hunt Class MCAS Spares, Repairs and Support

LOT_DESCRIPTION.P: Support for hunt class MCAS systems – the MCAS and associated equipment systems on the hunt class; PDS, technical services and production services for continuing design review, system update and support for MCAS Systems and associated peripherals and parts fitted to hunt class vessels and being installed at training establishments. Repair services for equipment listed in tender documents when issued. Supply of items of equipment listed in the tender documents. Assurance of the continued test/reference set facility availability. Much of this equipment is of specific OEM supply and ability to engage with this supplier will be paramount.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: Further information will be provided when the future competition is launched.

LOT_PRIOR_INFORMATION.LOT_TITLE: Support of T23 Pneumatic Temperature Controllers

LOT_DESCRIPTION.P: Support for moores temperature control units, which provide sea water cooling to T23 propulsion and power systems. For the controllers and associated test point service modules, DE&S require PDS, spares, repair work, obsolescence management and design reviews.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: Further information will be provided when the future competition is launched.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: Suppliers should note that the date given in the "Scheduled date for start of award procedures and duration of the contract" is purely an estimate.

Suppliers that are interested in participating in early market engagement activities are invited to register their interest via email to DESShipsComrcl-MCAS@mod.gov.uk marked for the attention of MCAS Commercial Team, responding no later than midday on 12.3.2018.

Suppliers should provide their full company name, company registration number and key contact details accompanied by a short description (no more than 100 words) of their company’s capabilities in regards to the scope that has been set out against each Lot. Suppliers should also state which lot(s) they may bid for. This will be used by DE&S for early market engagement planning purposes.

The Authority intends to meet with potential suppliers to obtain their feedback however, due to time and capacity constraints, the Authority may not be able to interact face to face with all interested parties. The Authority will share the outputs of all early market engagement activities to ensure that a fair and transparent process is followed.

DE&S will manage this early market engagement process in an open and transparent manner to maximise the possible benefits. Participation or non-participation in these early market engagement activities will not preclude or disadvantage/advantage any suppliers’ ability to participate in any future procurement activity.

MAIN_FINANCING_CONDITIONS.P: Not relevant for the PIN. To be provided in the Contract Notice.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: The Authority reserves the right to amend any condition related to security of information to reflect any changes in national law or government policy. If any contract documents are accompanied by instructions on safeguarding classified information (e.g. a Security aspects letter), the Authority reserves the right to amend the terms of these instructions to reflect any changes in national law or government policy, whether in respect of the applicable protective marking scheme, specific protective markings given, the aspects to which any protective marking applies, or otherwise. The link below to the Gov.uk website provides information on the Government Security Classification.
Advertising Regime OJEU:- This contract opportunity is published in the Official Journal of the European Union (OJEU),the MoD Defence Contracts Bulletin and www.contracts.mod.uk
For noting, the publication of this PIN is to commence early market engagement and is not a call for competition.
DE&S do not believe that the notice is suitable for VCOs therefore no bearing should be placed on the Period of Work Start and End Dates. GO Reference: GO-2018219-DCB-11936924.
